item.title: Is it enable To Host a Server With Port : 80 And not 43594?
item.dc:creator: @Mill Mill
item.description:
@Mill wrote:

[quote=“iil pk ii, post:1, topic:431012”]Is it enable To Host a Server With Port : 80 And not 43594 ?

Guys help pls typ yes or no[/quote]
I will not type yes or no, I will go into detail. Technically, it is possible if you are not currently running a webserver, and nothing is blocking the port. It is not recommended because not many toplists are going to let you choose port 80 for your server, what you should do is forward port 43594, 43595, or 5555. Those are the ports most commonly used for rsps. It shouldn’t be a problem client side because the clients open sockets rather than use a forwarded port.

How i portforward with a Vps? do you know it mayby
What VPS provider do you have? Most VPS companies have the ports unblocked by default, so it shouldn't be necessary.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it enable To Host a Server With Port : 80 And not 43594?

no, 80 is the port for a website. you can host a website with that port, but not a rsps.
